intro: Bupleurum bourgaei, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It features slender stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Bupleurum bourgaei is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
